DataElement.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Preschool Version Shift Scale T-Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the T-score for the Shift Scale in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Preschool Version.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function, Preschool Version Shift Scale T-Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale designed to specifically measure executive function in children aged 2 to 5 years. Parents, teachers, or other caregivers rate a child's executive functions within the context of the child's home or preschool environments._A rating scale included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function that measures the ability of an individual to move freely from one activity or situation to another, to tolerate change, to be flexible when solving problems, and to switch or alternate attention._A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function, Preschool Version
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale designed to specifically measure executive function in children aged 2 to 5 years. Parents, teachers, or other caregivers rate a childÂ¿s executive functions within the context of the child's home or preschool environments.

Concepts.longName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function, Preschool Version
Concepts.definition: A standardized rating scale designed to specifically measure executive function in children aged 2 to 5 years. Parents, teachers, or other caregivers rate a child's executive functions within the context of the child's home or preschool environments.

Property.preferredDefinition: A rating scale included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function that measures the ability of an individual to move freely from one activity or situation to another, to tolerate change, to be flexible when solving problems, and to switch or alternate attention.:A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

Concepts.definition: A rating scale included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function that measures the ability of an individual to move freely from one activity or situation to another, to tolerate change, to be flexible when solving problems, and to switch or alternate attention.

A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: BRIEF-P:Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Preschool Version. Gerard A. Gioia, PhD, Kimberly Andrews Espy, PhD, and Peter K. Isquith, PhD, Psychological Assessment Resources, Lutz, FL, 2003
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for COG study in Rave per request by W.Wong. mc 4/2/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity that represents the conversion of an individual score into a standard form made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean for the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
